from typing import Any
from urllib.parse import urljoin
from langchain_experimental.llms.ollama_functions import OllamaFunctions
import httpx
from langchain_community.chat_models import ChatOllama

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, DictInput, DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, StrInput


class ChatOllamaComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Ollama Function"
    description = "Generate text using Ollama Local LLMs."
    icon = "Ollama"
    name = "OllamaFunctionModel"

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dict, field_value: Any, field_name: str | None = None):
        if field_name == "mirostat":
            if field_value == "Disabled":
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = None
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = None

            else:
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = False
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = False

                if field_value == "Mirostat 2.0":
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.2
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 10
                else:
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.1
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 5

        if field_name == "model_name":
            base_url_dict = build_config.get("base_url", {})
            base_url_load_from_db = base_url_dict.get("load_from_db", False)
            base_url_value = base_url_dict.get("value")
            if base_url_load_from_db:
                base_url_value = self.variables(base_url_value)
            elif not base_url_value:
                base_url_value = "http://localhost:11434"
            build_config["model_name"]["options"] = self.get_model(base_url_value)
        if field_name == "keep_alive_flag":
            if field_value == "Keep":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "-1"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            elif field_value == "Immediately":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "0"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            else:
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = False

        return build_config

    def get_model(self, base_url_value: str) -> list[str]:
        try:
            url = urljoin(base_url_value, "/api/tags")
            with httpx.Client() as client:
                response = client.get(url)
                response.raise_for_status()
                data = response.json()

                model_names = [model["name"] for model in data.get("models", [])]
                return model_names
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not retrieve models. Please, make sure Ollama is running.") from e

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        StrInput(
            name="base_url",
            display_name="Base URL",
            info="Endpoint of the Ollama API. Defaults to 'http://localhost:11434' if not specified.",
            value="http://localhost:11434",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            value="llama3.1",
            info="Refer to https://ollama.com/library for more models.",
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="temperature",
            display_name="Temperature",
            value=0.2,
            info="Controls the creativity of model responses.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="format",
            display_name="Format",
            info="Specify the format of the output (e.g., json).",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="metadata",
            display_name="Metadata",
            info="Metadata to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="mirostat",
            display_name="Mirostat",
            options=["Disabled", "Mirostat", "Mirostat 2.0"],
            info="Enable/disable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity.",
            value="Disabled",
            advanced=True,
            real_time_refresh=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_eta",
            display_name="Mirostat Eta",
            info="Learning rate for Mirostat algorithm. (Default: 0.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_tau",
            display_name="Mirostat Tau",
            info="Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. (Default: 5.0)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_ctx",
            display_name="Context Window Size",
            info="Size of the context window for generating tokens. (Default: 2048)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_gpu",
            display_name="Number of GPUs",
            info="Number of GPUs to use for computation. (Default: 1 on macOS, 0 to disable)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_thread",
            display_name="Number of Threads",
            info="Number of threads to use during computation. (Default: detected for optimal performance)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="repeat_last_n",
            display_name="Repeat Last N",
            info="How far back the model looks to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="repeat_penalty",
            display_name="Repeat Penalty",
            info="Penalty for repetitions in generated text. (Default: 1.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="tfs_z",
            display_name="TFS Z",
            info="Tail free sampling value. (Default: 1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout",
            info="Timeout for the request stream.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="top_k",
            display_name="Top K",
            info="Limits token selection to top K. (Default: 40)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="top_p",
            display_name="Top P",
            info="Works together with top-k. (Default: 0.9)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="verbose",
            display_name="Verbose",
            info="Whether to print out response text.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="tags",
            display_name="Tags",
            info="Comma-separated list of tags to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="stop_tokens",
            display_name="Stop Tokens",
            info="Comma-separated list of tokens to signal the model to stop generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="system",
            display_name="System",
            info="System to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="Template to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # Mapping mirostat settings to their corresponding values
        mirostat_options = {"Mirostat": 1, "Mirostat 2.0": 2}

        # Default to 0 for 'Disabled'
        mirostat_value = mirostat_options.get(self.mirostat, 0)  # type: ignore

        # Set mirostat_eta and mirostat_tau to None if mirostat is disabled
        if mirostat_value == 0:
            mirostat_eta = None
            mirostat_tau = None
        else:
            mirostat_eta = self.mirostat_eta
            mirostat_tau = self.mirostat_tau

        # Mapping system settings to their corresponding values
        llm_params = {
            "base_url": self.base_url,
            "model": self.model_name,
            "mirostat": mirostat_value,
            "format": self.format,
            "metadata": self.metadata,
            "tags": self.tags.split(",") if self.tags else None,
            "mirostat_eta": mirostat_eta,
            "mirostat_tau": mirostat_tau,
            "num_ctx": self.num_ctx or None,
            "num_gpu": self.num_gpu or None,
            "num_thread": self.num_thread or None,
            "repeat_last_n": self.repeat_last_n or None,
            "repeat_penalty": self.repeat_penalty or None,
            "temperature": self.temperature or None,
            "stop": self.stop_tokens.split(",") if self.stop_tokens else None,
            "system": self.system,
            "template": self.template,
            "tfs_z": self.tfs_z or None,
            "timeout": self.timeout or None,
            "top_k": self.top_k or None,
            "top_p": self.top_p or None,
            "verbose": self.verbose,
        }

        # Remove parameters with None values
        llm_params = {k: v for k, v in llm_params.items() if v is not None}

        try:
            output = OllamaFunctions(**llm_params)  # type: ignore
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not initialize Ollama LLM.") from e

        return output  # type: ignore

backstory.value:
skills required for a Project Director in the game industry:

    Leadership and Management: The ability to lead, motivate, and manage a team of developers, designers, and other professionals.
    Communication and Collaboration: Strong communication and collaboration skills are necessary to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
    Project Planning and Management: Proven experience in managing projects from conception to completion, including developing project plans, timelines, and budgets.
    Risk Management: The ability to identify and mitigate risks that could impact project success.
    Problem-Solving and Adaptability: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to changing project requirements or unexpected setbacks.
    Time Management and Organization: Effective time management and organizational skills are essential to meet project deadlines and ensure smooth project execution.
    Agile Methodology: Familiarity with Agile methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, is often required in the game industry.
    Creativity and Innovation: A passion for games and a willingness to think creatively can help Project Directors bring innovative ideas to projects.
    Customer Focus: Understanding the needs of gamers and delivering an excellent gaming experience requires a customer-centric approach.

By possessing these skills, a Project Director can effectively lead teams and deliver successful game projects that meet the expectations of players and stakeholders.

from crewai import Agent  # type: ignore

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, DictInput, HandleInput, MultilineInput, Output


class CrewAIAgentComponent(Component):
    display_name = "CrewAI Agent"
    description = "Represents an agent of CrewAI."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.crewai.com/how-to/LLM-Connections/"
    icon = "CrewAI"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(name="role", display_name="Role", info="The role of the agent."),
        MultilineInput(name="goal", display_name="Goal", info="The objective of the agent."),
        MultilineInput(name="backstory", display_name="Backstory", info="The backstory of the agent."),
        HandleInput(
            name="tools",
            display_name="Tools",
            input_types=["Tool"],
            is_list=True,
            info="Tools at agents disposal",
            value=[],
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="llm",
            display_name="Language Model",
            info="Language model that will run the agent.",
            input_types=["LanguageModel"],
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="memory",
            display_name="Memory",
            info="Whether the agent should have memory or not",
            advanced=True,
            value=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="verbose",
            display_name="Verbose",
            advanced=True,
            value=False,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="allow_delegation",
            display_name="Allow Delegation",
            info="Whether the agent is allowed to delegate tasks to other agents.",
            value=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="allow_code_execution",
            display_name="Allow Code Execution",
            info="Whether the agent is allowed to execute code.",
            value=False,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="kwargs",
            display_name="kwargs",
            info="kwargs of agent.",
            is_list=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Agent", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Agent:
        kwargs = self.kwargs if self.kwargs else {}
        agent = Agent(
            role=self.role,
            goal=self.goal,
            backstory=self.backstory,
            llm=self.llm,
            verbose=self.verbose,
            memory=self.memory,
            tools=self.tools if self.tools else [],
            allow_delegation=self.allow_delegation,
            allow_code_execution=self.allow_code_execution,
            max_execution_time=5000,
            max_iterations=50,
            max_iter=50,
            **kwargs,
        )
        self.status = repr(agent)
        return agent

from crewai import Crew, Process  # type: ignore

from axiestudio.base.agents.crewai.crew import BaseCrewComponent
from axiestudio.io import HandleInput


class HierarchicalCrewComponent(BaseCrewComponent):
    display_name: str = "Hierarchical Crew"
    description: str = (
        "Represents a group of agents, defining how they should collaborate and the tasks they should perform."
    )
    documentation: str = "https://docs.crewai.com/how-to/Hierarchical/"
    icon = "CrewAI"

    inputs = BaseCrewComponent._base_inputs + [
        HandleInput(name="agents", display_name="Agents", input_types=["Agent"], is_list=True),
        HandleInput(name="tasks", display_name="Tasks", input_types=["HierarchicalTask"], is_list=True),
        HandleInput(name="manager_llm", display_name="Manager LLM", input_types=["LanguageModel"], required=False),
        HandleInput(name="manager_agent", display_name="Manager Agent", input_types=["Agent"], required=False),
    ]

    def build_crew(self) -> Crew:
        tasks, agents = self.get_tasks_and_agents()
        crew = Crew(
            agents=agents,
            tasks=tasks,
            process=Process.hierarchical,
            verbose=self.verbose,
            memory=self.memory,
            cache=self.use_cache,
            max_rpm=self.max_rpm,
            share_crew=self.share_crew,
            function_calling_llm=self.function_calling_llm,
            manager_agent=self.manager_agent,
            manager_llm=self.manager_llm,
            step_callback=self.get_step_callback(),
            task_callback=self.get_task_callback(),
            max_execution_time=5000,
            max_iterations=50,
            max_iter=50,
        )
        return crew

from axiestudio.base.agents.crewai.tasks import HierarchicalTask
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import HandleInput, MultilineInput, Output


class HierarchicalTaskComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Hierarchical Task"
    description: str = "Each task must have a description, an expected output and an agent responsible for execution."
    icon = "CrewAI"
    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="task_description",
            display_name="Description",
            info="Descriptive text detailing task's purpose and execution.",
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="expected_output",
            display_name="Expected Output",
            info="Clear definition of expected task outcome.",
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="tools",
            display_name="Tools",
            input_types=["Tool"],
            is_list=True,
            info="List of tools/resources limited for task execution. Uses the Agent tools by default.",
            required=False,
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Task", name="task_output", method="build_task"),
    ]

    def build_task(self) -> HierarchicalTask:
        task = HierarchicalTask(
            description=self.task_description,
            expected_output=self.expected_output,
            tools=self.tools or [],
        )
        self.status = task
        return task

backstory.name: backstory
backstory.value:
skills required for a Game Designer in the game industry:

    Creativity and Originality: The ability to come up with innovative ideas and solutions that enhance gameplay experiences.
    Gameplay Mechanics Knowledge: In-depth understanding of various game mechanics, such as movement systems, combat mechanics, or puzzle design.
    Player Psychology and Behavior: Understanding how players interact with games and what motivates them to play.
    Design Principles and Theories: Familiarity with game design principles, such as balance, difficulty curve, and level progression.
    Communication and Collaboration: Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
    Prototyping and Testing: Ability to create prototypes and test game concepts to validate design ideas.
    Storytelling and Narrative: Understanding of how to integrate narrative elements into gameplay experiences.
    User Experience (UX) Design: Knowledge of how to create user-friendly and intuitive interfaces for players.
    Game Engines and Tools: Familiarity with game engines, such as Unity or Unreal Engine, and design tools, like Maya or 3D modeling software.
    Adaptability and Flexibility: Willingness to adapt designs based on feedback from team members, stakeholders, or playtesting results.

Some additional skills that can be beneficial for Game Designers include:

    Programming languages (e.g., C#, Java, Python)
    Art and design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, 3D modeling tools)
    Sound design principles
    User research methods
    Data analysis and interpretation

By possessing these skills, a Game Designer can create engaging gameplay experiences that captivate players and contribute to the overall success of a game project.

backstory.name: backstory
backstory.value:
skills required for a Game Developer in the game industry:

    Programming Languages: Proficiency in one or more programming languages commonly used in game development, such as:
        C# (Unity)
        Java (Android games, PC games)
        Python (Unity, Pygame)
        C++ (PC games, console games)
    Game Engines and Frameworks: Familiarity with popular game engines and frameworks, such as:
        Unity
        Unreal Engine
        Godot
    Data Structures and Algorithms: Understanding of data structures and algorithms that are commonly used in game development, such as:
        Arrays, lists, stacks, and queues
        Trees, graphs, and networking
    Object-Oriented Programming (OOP): Knowledge of OOP principles, including inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.
    Game Development Tools: Familiarity with tools used for game development, such as:
        Version control systems (e.g., Git)
        Code editors and IDEs (e.g., Visual Studio, IntelliJ)
    Debugging and Troubleshooting: Ability to identify and fix issues in game code using debugging techniques and tools.
    Collaboration and Communication: Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
    Adaptability and Flexibility: Willingness to adapt to changing project requirements, new technologies, or unexpected setbacks.

Some additional skills that can be beneficial for Game Developers include:

    Knowledge of game design principles and concepts
    Familiarity with game development pipelines and workflows
    Understanding of game testing and QA processes

        Audio editing software (e.g., Audacity, Adobe Audition)

By possessing these skills, a Game Developer can create engaging gameplay experiences that captivate players and contribute to the overall success of a game project.

from typing import Any
from urllib.parse import urljoin
from langchain_experimental.llms.ollama_functions import OllamaFunctions
import httpx
from langchain_community.chat_models import ChatOllama

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, DictInput, DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, StrInput


class ChatOllamaComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Ollama Function"
    description = "Generate text using Ollama Local LLMs."
    icon = "Ollama"
    name = "OllamaFunctionModel"

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dict, field_value: Any, field_name: str | None = None):
        if field_name == "mirostat":
            if field_value == "Disabled":
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = None
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = None

            else:
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = False
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = False

                if field_value == "Mirostat 2.0":
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.2
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 10
                else:
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.1
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 5

        if field_name == "model_name":
            base_url_dict = build_config.get("base_url", {})
            base_url_load_from_db = base_url_dict.get("load_from_db", False)
            base_url_value = base_url_dict.get("value")
            if base_url_load_from_db:
                base_url_value = self.variables(base_url_value)
            elif not base_url_value:
                base_url_value = "http://localhost:11434"
            build_config["model_name"]["options"] = self.get_model(base_url_value)
        if field_name == "keep_alive_flag":
            if field_value == "Keep":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "-1"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            elif field_value == "Immediately":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "0"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            else:
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = False

        return build_config

    def get_model(self, base_url_value: str) -> list[str]:
        try:
            url = urljoin(base_url_value, "/api/tags")
            with httpx.Client() as client:
                response = client.get(url)
                response.raise_for_status()
                data = response.json()

                model_names = [model["name"] for model in data.get("models", [])]
                return model_names
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not retrieve models. Please, make sure Ollama is running.") from e

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        StrInput(
            name="base_url",
            display_name="Base URL",
            info="Endpoint of the Ollama API. Defaults to 'http://localhost:11434' if not specified.",
            value="http://localhost:11434",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            value="llama3.1",
            info="Refer to https://ollama.com/library for more models.",
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="temperature",
            display_name="Temperature",
            value=0.2,
            info="Controls the creativity of model responses.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="format",
            display_name="Format",
            info="Specify the format of the output (e.g., json).",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="metadata",
            display_name="Metadata",
            info="Metadata to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="mirostat",
            display_name="Mirostat",
            options=["Disabled", "Mirostat", "Mirostat 2.0"],
            info="Enable/disable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity.",
            value="Disabled",
            advanced=True,
            real_time_refresh=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_eta",
            display_name="Mirostat Eta",
            info="Learning rate for Mirostat algorithm. (Default: 0.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_tau",
            display_name="Mirostat Tau",
            info="Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. (Default: 5.0)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_ctx",
            display_name="Context Window Size",
            info="Size of the context window for generating tokens. (Default: 2048)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_gpu",
            display_name="Number of GPUs",
            info="Number of GPUs to use for computation. (Default: 1 on macOS, 0 to disable)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_thread",
            display_name="Number of Threads",
            info="Number of threads to use during computation. (Default: detected for optimal performance)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="repeat_last_n",
            display_name="Repeat Last N",
            info="How far back the model looks to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="repeat_penalty",
            display_name="Repeat Penalty",
            info="Penalty for repetitions in generated text. (Default: 1.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="tfs_z",
            display_name="TFS Z",
            info="Tail free sampling value. (Default: 1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout",
            info="Timeout for the request stream.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="top_k",
            display_name="Top K",
            info="Limits token selection to top K. (Default: 40)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="top_p",
            display_name="Top P",
            info="Works together with top-k. (Default: 0.9)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="verbose",
            display_name="Verbose",
            info="Whether to print out response text.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="tags",
            display_name="Tags",
            info="Comma-separated list of tags to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="stop_tokens",
            display_name="Stop Tokens",
            info="Comma-separated list of tokens to signal the model to stop generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="system",
            display_name="System",
            info="System to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="Template to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # Mapping mirostat settings to their corresponding values
        mirostat_options = {"Mirostat": 1, "Mirostat 2.0": 2}

        # Default to 0 for 'Disabled'
        mirostat_value = mirostat_options.get(self.mirostat, 0)  # type: ignore

        # Set mirostat_eta and mirostat_tau to None if mirostat is disabled
        if mirostat_value == 0:
            mirostat_eta = None
            mirostat_tau = None
        else:
            mirostat_eta = self.mirostat_eta
            mirostat_tau = self.mirostat_tau

        # Mapping system settings to their corresponding values
        llm_params = {
            "base_url": self.base_url,
            "model": self.model_name,
            "mirostat": mirostat_value,
            "format": self.format,
            "metadata": self.metadata,
            "tags": self.tags.split(",") if self.tags else None,
            "mirostat_eta": mirostat_eta,
            "mirostat_tau": mirostat_tau,
            "num_ctx": self.num_ctx or None,
            "num_gpu": self.num_gpu or None,
            "num_thread": self.num_thread or None,
            "repeat_last_n": self.repeat_last_n or None,
            "repeat_penalty": self.repeat_penalty or None,
            "temperature": self.temperature or None,
            "stop": self.stop_tokens.split(",") if self.stop_tokens else None,
            "system": self.system,
            "template": self.template,
            "tfs_z": self.tfs_z or None,
            "timeout": self.timeout or None,
            "top_k": self.top_k or None,
            "top_p": self.top_p or None,
            "verbose": self.verbose,
        }

        # Remove parameters with None values
        llm_params = {k: v for k, v in llm_params.items() if v is not None}

        try:
            output = OllamaFunctions(**llm_params)  # type: ignore
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not initialize Ollama LLM.") from e

        return output  # type: ignore

skills required for a Level Designer in the game industry:

    Gameplay Mechanics Knowledge: Understanding of gameplay mechanics, such as movement systems, combat mechanics, or puzzle design.
    Level Design Principles: Familiarity with level design principles, including:
        Flow and pacing
        Difficulty curve and progression
        Player interaction and engagement
    Art and Design Skills: Ability to create and edit 2D/3D art, textures, and visual effects that enhance the game environment.
    Spatial Reasoning and Problem-Solving: Strong spatial reasoning skills to design levels with logical flow and navigation.
    Game Engines and Tools: Familiarity with popular game engines and level editing tools, such as:
        Unity
        Unreal Engine
        Maya or 3D modeling software
    Storytelling and Narrative: Understanding of how to integrate narrative elements into gameplay experiences through level design.
    Player Psychology and Behavior: Knowledge of player psychology and behavior to create levels that engage and challenge players.
    Collaboration and Communication: Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

Some additional skills that can be beneficial for Level Designers include:

    Experience with game development pipelines and workflows
    Familiarity with audio design principles and implementation
    Understanding of physics engines and collision detection
    Knowledge of data analysis and interpretation to inform design decisions

By possessing these skills, a Level Designer can create engaging and challenging levels that enhance player engagement and contribute to the overall success of a game project.

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

Overall, a Quality Assurance Engineer plays a vital role in ensuring that games meet high standards of quality, performance, and stability. Their attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills make them an essential part of any game development team.

goal.value:
A Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer plays a crucial role in ensuring that games are released on time, within budget, and to a high standard of quality. Their primary responsibility is to identify and report bugs, glitches, and other issues in the game, as well as collaborate with the development team to resolve them.

Key Responsibilities:

    Test Game Development: QA Engineers create test plans and scripts to cover all aspects of the game, including gameplay mechanics, user interface, audio, and visual effects.
    Testing: They playtest games on various platforms (e.g., PC, console, mobile) to identify bugs, glitches, and areas for improvement.
    Bug Reporting: QA Engineers document and report defects found during testing, providing detailed descriptions of the issue, steps to reproduce, and expected behavior.
    Collaboration: They work closely with the development team to identify root causes of issues, develop fixes, and implement changes.
    Test Automation: QA Engineers may be responsible for creating automated tests to validate game functionality and reduce manual testing efforts.
    Test Environment Maintenance: They ensure that test environments are stable, reliable, and well-maintained.

Required Skills:

    Audio Knowledge: Understanding of audio principles, acoustics, psychoacoustics, and audio engineering techniques.
    Software Proficiency: Proficiency in industry-standard audio editing software (e.g., Pro Tools, Logic Pro X), sound design tools (e.g., FMOD, Wwise), and 3D audio software (e.g., iZotope RX, Melodyne).
    Creativity and Problem-Solving: Ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions for sound design challenges.
    Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail is essential for crafting high-quality sound effects, FX chains, and audio cues.
    Collaboration and Communication: Strong communication skills to work effectively with the development team, including producers, directors, and artists.
    Audio Technology: Familiarity with audio technologies, such as audio middleware platforms (e.g., FMOD), 3D audio software (e.g., iZotope RX), and game engine plugins.

Nice to Have Skills:

    Music Composition: Ability to compose music that complements the game's atmosphere and gameplay.
    Recording Techniques: Knowledge of recording techniques, such as field recording, voice acting, and Foley capture.
    Game Development Experience: Familiarity with game development concepts, including audio pipelines, sound design for narrative-driven games, or post-production workflows.
    Post-Production Skills: Understanding of video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro) and ability to work with visual effects.
    Audio Equipment Proficiency: Familiarity with audio equipment, such as microphones, preamps, and mixers.

Work Environment:

Sound Designers in the game industry often work in a studio environment, collaborating with other sound designers, artists, and developers to create high-quality audio content for games. They may also attend recording sessions, capture Foley, or participate in game development workshops.

In summary, Sound Designer is responsible for creating and implementing engaging audio elements that enhance gameplay and atmosphere in the game industry. Their expertise in audio technology, software proficiency, and collaboration with the development team make them a valuable asset to any game development project.

    Collaboration: Work closely with the development team, including producers, directors, and artists, to ensure that sound design meets project goals and expectations.
    Quality Control: Monitor game performance and make adjustments to sound effects, music, and Foley as needed to maintain optimal audio quality.

from typing import Any
from urllib.parse import urljoin
from langchain_experimental.llms.ollama_functions import OllamaFunctions
import httpx
from langchain_community.chat_models import ChatOllama

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, DictInput, DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, StrInput


class ChatOllamaComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Ollama Function"
    description = "Generate text using Ollama Local LLMs."
    icon = "Ollama"
    name = "OllamaFunctionModel"

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dict, field_value: Any, field_name: str | None = None):
        if field_name == "mirostat":
            if field_value == "Disabled":
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = None
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = None

            else:
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = False
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = False

                if field_value == "Mirostat 2.0":
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.2
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 10
                else:
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.1
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 5

        if field_name == "model_name":
            base_url_dict = build_config.get("base_url", {})
            base_url_load_from_db = base_url_dict.get("load_from_db", False)
            base_url_value = base_url_dict.get("value")
            if base_url_load_from_db:
                base_url_value = self.variables(base_url_value)
            elif not base_url_value:
                base_url_value = "http://localhost:11434"
            build_config["model_name"]["options"] = self.get_model(base_url_value)
        if field_name == "keep_alive_flag":
            if field_value == "Keep":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "-1"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            elif field_value == "Immediately":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "0"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            else:
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = False

        return build_config

    def get_model(self, base_url_value: str) -> list[str]:
        try:
            url = urljoin(base_url_value, "/api/tags")
            with httpx.Client() as client:
                response = client.get(url)
                response.raise_for_status()
                data = response.json()

                model_names = [model["name"] for model in data.get("models", [])]
                return model_names
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not retrieve models. Please, make sure Ollama is running.") from e

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        StrInput(
            name="base_url",
            display_name="Base URL",
            info="Endpoint of the Ollama API. Defaults to 'http://localhost:11434' if not specified.",
            value="http://localhost:11434",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            value="llama3.1",
            info="Refer to https://ollama.com/library for more models.",
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="temperature",
            display_name="Temperature",
            value=0.2,
            info="Controls the creativity of model responses.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="format",
            display_name="Format",
            info="Specify the format of the output (e.g., json).",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="metadata",
            display_name="Metadata",
            info="Metadata to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="mirostat",
            display_name="Mirostat",
            options=["Disabled", "Mirostat", "Mirostat 2.0"],
            info="Enable/disable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity.",
            value="Disabled",
            advanced=True,
            real_time_refresh=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_eta",
            display_name="Mirostat Eta",
            info="Learning rate for Mirostat algorithm. (Default: 0.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_tau",
            display_name="Mirostat Tau",
            info="Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. (Default: 5.0)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_ctx",
            display_name="Context Window Size",
            info="Size of the context window for generating tokens. (Default: 2048)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_gpu",
            display_name="Number of GPUs",
            info="Number of GPUs to use for computation. (Default: 1 on macOS, 0 to disable)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_thread",
            display_name="Number of Threads",
            info="Number of threads to use during computation. (Default: detected for optimal performance)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="repeat_last_n",
            display_name="Repeat Last N",
            info="How far back the model looks to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="repeat_penalty",
            display_name="Repeat Penalty",
            info="Penalty for repetitions in generated text. (Default: 1.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="tfs_z",
            display_name="TFS Z",
            info="Tail free sampling value. (Default: 1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout",
            info="Timeout for the request stream.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="top_k",
            display_name="Top K",
            info="Limits token selection to top K. (Default: 40)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="top_p",
            display_name="Top P",
            info="Works together with top-k. (Default: 0.9)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="verbose",
            display_name="Verbose",
            info="Whether to print out response text.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="tags",
            display_name="Tags",
            info="Comma-separated list of tags to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="stop_tokens",
            display_name="Stop Tokens",
            info="Comma-separated list of tokens to signal the model to stop generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="system",
            display_name="System",
            info="System to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="Template to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # Mapping mirostat settings to their corresponding values
        mirostat_options = {"Mirostat": 1, "Mirostat 2.0": 2}

        # Default to 0 for 'Disabled'
        mirostat_value = mirostat_options.get(self.mirostat, 0)  # type: ignore

        # Set mirostat_eta and mirostat_tau to None if mirostat is disabled
        if mirostat_value == 0:
            mirostat_eta = None
            mirostat_tau = None
        else:
            mirostat_eta = self.mirostat_eta
            mirostat_tau = self.mirostat_tau

        # Mapping system settings to their corresponding values
        llm_params = {
            "base_url": self.base_url,
            "model": self.model_name,
            "mirostat": mirostat_value,
            "format": self.format,
            "metadata": self.metadata,
            "tags": self.tags.split(",") if self.tags else None,
            "mirostat_eta": mirostat_eta,
            "mirostat_tau": mirostat_tau,
            "num_ctx": self.num_ctx or None,
            "num_gpu": self.num_gpu or None,
            "num_thread": self.num_thread or None,
            "repeat_last_n": self.repeat_last_n or None,
            "repeat_penalty": self.repeat_penalty or None,
            "temperature": self.temperature or None,
            "stop": self.stop_tokens.split(",") if self.stop_tokens else None,
            "system": self.system,
            "template": self.template,
            "tfs_z": self.tfs_z or None,
            "timeout": self.timeout or None,
            "top_k": self.top_k or None,
            "top_p": self.top_p or None,
            "verbose": self.verbose,
        }

        # Remove parameters with None values
        llm_params = {k: v for k, v in llm_params.items() if v is not None}

        try:
            output = OllamaFunctions(**llm_params)  # type: ignore
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not initialize Ollama LLM.") from e

        return output  # type: ignore

from crewai import Agent  # type: ignore

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, DictInput, HandleInput, MultilineInput, Output


class CrewAIAgentComponent(Component):
    display_name = "CrewAI Agent"
    description = "Represents an agent of CrewAI."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.crewai.com/how-to/LLM-Connections/"
    icon = "CrewAI"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(name="role", display_name="Role", info="The role of the agent."),
        MultilineInput(name="goal", display_name="Goal", info="The objective of the agent."),
        MultilineInput(name="backstory", display_name="Backstory", info="The backstory of the agent."),
        HandleInput(
            name="tools",
            display_name="Tools",
            input_types=["Tool"],
            is_list=True,
            info="Tools at agents disposal",
            value=[],
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="llm",
            display_name="Language Model",
            info="Language model that will run the agent.",
            input_types=["LanguageModel"],
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="memory",
            display_name="Memory",
            info="Whether the agent should have memory or not",
            advanced=True,
            value=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="verbose",
            display_name="Verbose",
            advanced=True,
            value=False,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="allow_delegation",
            display_name="Allow Delegation",
            info="Whether the agent is allowed to delegate tasks to other agents.",
            value=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="allow_code_execution",
            display_name="Allow Code Execution",
            info="Whether the agent is allowed to execute code.",
            value=False,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="kwargs",
            display_name="kwargs",
            info="kwargs of agent.",
            is_list=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Agent", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Agent:
        kwargs = self.kwargs if self.kwargs else {}
        agent = Agent(
            role=self.role,
            goal=self.goal,
            backstory=self.backstory,
            llm=self.llm,
            verbose=self.verbose,
            memory=self.memory,
            tools=self.tools if self.tools else [],
            allow_delegation=self.allow_delegation,
            allow_code_execution=self.allow_code_execution,
            **kwargs,
        )
        self.status = repr(agent)
        return agent

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)

You are tasked with designing a comprehensive AI-driven project using the CrewAI framework. The goal of this project is : {OverallGoal}. This project will involve multiple agents, each with distinct roles, backstories, and goals. The project will utilize a variety of tools, require collaboration among agents, and incorporate processes like planning, coding, testing, and memory.

Context:
{Context}

Key Requirements:
Agents:

Project Director, Game Designer, Level Designer, Game Developer, Quality Assurance Engineer, Game Artist, Sound Designer, Documentation Specialist
Understand what are their abilities to reach the goal of the project.
Tasks:

Create tasks that align with the roles of the agents. Each task should have a clear description and expected output.
{Tasks}
Ensure tasks are well-defined with clear expected outputs and associated tools.
Tools:

Utilize a variety of tools within the CrewAI framework, including search engines, file writer.
If necessary, create custom tools that agents can use to perform their tasks.
Integrate tools for specific tasks, ensuring that each tool is appropriate for the task at hand.
Processes:

Define the processes by which tasks will be executed (e.g., sequential, parallel, hierarchical).
Include steps for planning and testing to ensure quality output.
Incorporate feedback loops for continuous improvement throughout the process.
Collaboration:

Ensure that agents collaborate effectively by sharing information and resources.
Design mechanisms for agents to communicate and delegate tasks to each other.
Include a collaboration strategy for integrating human input during critical stages.
Training:

Include a training phase for agents to fine-tune their skills before they begin the main tasks.
Define how training data will be used to improve agent performance.
Create tasks that simulate real-world scenarios to test agent capabilities.
Memory:

Implement a memory system that allows agents to remember important details, past interactions, and decisions.
Use memory to enable agents to build upon previous work and avoid redundancy.
Ensure memory is persistent and accessible across tasks and processes.
Planning and Testing:

Design a planning phase where agents map out their approach to tasks.
Include development, testing phases where agents validate their findings, prototypes, or written reports.
Ensure that planning and testing are iterative, with opportunities for agents to refine their strategies.
Development:

Develop the project from beginning to end, only using your own code, own svg generated graphics, and own midi sounds and musics.
Final Output:

The final output of this CrewAI project should be {FinalDeliverable}.
The deliverable should include {FinalOutput}.
The deliverable must be detailed, well-organized, and suitable for publication or presentation.
Additional Considerations:
Make sure that the agents can handle unexpected changes or new information during the project.
The system should be robust enough to allow human intervention or input at key decision points.
Consider how to evaluate the effectiveness of the agents and the overall success of the project.
Final Deliverable:

The final deliverable should be a complete CrewAI project setup, including all agents, tasks, tools, coding, and processes. The project should be ready to execute and provide the expected output in a seamless and efficient manner.

from typing import Any
from urllib.parse import urljoin

import httpx
from langchain_community.chat_models import ChatOllama

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, DictInput, DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, StrInput


class ChatOllamaComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Ollama"
    description = "Generate text using Ollama Local LLMs."
    icon = "Ollama"
    name = "OllamaModel"

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dict, field_value: Any, field_name: str | None = None):
        if field_name == "mirostat":
            if field_value == "Disabled":
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = True
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = None
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = None

            else:
                build_config["mirostat_eta"]["advanced"] = False
                build_config["mirostat_tau"]["advanced"] = False

                if field_value == "Mirostat 2.0":
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.2
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 10
                else:
                    build_config["mirostat_eta"]["value"] = 0.1
                    build_config["mirostat_tau"]["value"] = 5

        if field_name == "model_name":
            base_url_dict = build_config.get("base_url", {})
            base_url_load_from_db = base_url_dict.get("load_from_db", False)
            base_url_value = base_url_dict.get("value")
            if base_url_load_from_db:
                base_url_value = self.variables(base_url_value)
            elif not base_url_value:
                base_url_value = "http://localhost:11434"
            build_config["model_name"]["options"] = self.get_model(base_url_value)
        if field_name == "keep_alive_flag":
            if field_value == "Keep":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "-1"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            elif field_value == "Immediately":
                build_config["keep_alive"]["value"] = "0"
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = True
            else:
                build_config["keep_alive"]["advanced"] = False

        return build_config

    def get_model(self, base_url_value: str) -> list[str]:
        try:
            url = urljoin(base_url_value, "/api/tags")
            with httpx.Client() as client:
                response = client.get(url)
                response.raise_for_status()
                data = response.json()

                model_names = [model["name"] for model in data.get("models", [])]
                return model_names
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not retrieve models. Please, make sure Ollama is running.") from e

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        StrInput(
            name="base_url",
            display_name="Base URL",
            info="Endpoint of the Ollama API. Defaults to 'http://localhost:11434' if not specified.",
            value="http://localhost:11434",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            value="llama3.1",
            info="Refer to https://ollama.com/library for more models.",
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="temperature",
            display_name="Temperature",
            value=0.2,
            info="Controls the creativity of model responses.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="format",
            display_name="Format",
            info="Specify the format of the output (e.g., json).",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="metadata",
            display_name="Metadata",
            info="Metadata to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="mirostat",
            display_name="Mirostat",
            options=["Disabled", "Mirostat", "Mirostat 2.0"],
            info="Enable/disable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity.",
            value="Disabled",
            advanced=True,
            real_time_refresh=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_eta",
            display_name="Mirostat Eta",
            info="Learning rate for Mirostat algorithm. (Default: 0.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mirostat_tau",
            display_name="Mirostat Tau",
            info="Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. (Default: 5.0)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_ctx",
            display_name="Context Window Size",
            info="Size of the context window for generating tokens. (Default: 2048)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_gpu",
            display_name="Number of GPUs",
            info="Number of GPUs to use for computation. (Default: 1 on macOS, 0 to disable)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="num_thread",
            display_name="Number of Threads",
            info="Number of threads to use during computation. (Default: detected for optimal performance)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="repeat_last_n",
            display_name="Repeat Last N",
            info="How far back the model looks to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="repeat_penalty",
            display_name="Repeat Penalty",
            info="Penalty for repetitions in generated text. (Default: 1.1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="tfs_z",
            display_name="TFS Z",
            info="Tail free sampling value. (Default: 1)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout",
            info="Timeout for the request stream.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="top_k",
            display_name="Top K",
            info="Limits token selection to top K. (Default: 40)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="top_p",
            display_name="Top P",
            info="Works together with top-k. (Default: 0.9)",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="verbose",
            display_name="Verbose",
            info="Whether to print out response text.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="tags",
            display_name="Tags",
            info="Comma-separated list of tags to add to the run trace.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="stop_tokens",
            display_name="Stop Tokens",
            info="Comma-separated list of tokens to signal the model to stop generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="system",
            display_name="System",
            info="System to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="Template to use for generating text.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # Mapping mirostat settings to their corresponding values
        mirostat_options = {"Mirostat": 1, "Mirostat 2.0": 2}

        # Default to 0 for 'Disabled'
        mirostat_value = mirostat_options.get(self.mirostat, 0)  # type: ignore

        # Set mirostat_eta and mirostat_tau to None if mirostat is disabled
        if mirostat_value == 0:
            mirostat_eta = None
            mirostat_tau = None
        else:
            mirostat_eta = self.mirostat_eta
            mirostat_tau = self.mirostat_tau

        # Mapping system settings to their corresponding values
        llm_params = {
            "base_url": self.base_url,
            "model": self.model_name,
            "mirostat": mirostat_value,
            "format": self.format,
            "metadata": self.metadata,
            "tags": self.tags.split(",") if self.tags else None,
            "mirostat_eta": mirostat_eta,
            "mirostat_tau": mirostat_tau,
            "num_ctx": self.num_ctx or None,
            "num_gpu": self.num_gpu or None,
            "num_thread": self.num_thread or None,
            "repeat_last_n": self.repeat_last_n or None,
            "repeat_penalty": self.repeat_penalty or None,
            "temperature": self.temperature or None,
            "stop": self.stop_tokens.split(",") if self.stop_tokens else None,
            "system": self.system,
            "template": self.template,
            "tfs_z": self.tfs_z or None,
            "timeout": self.timeout or None,
            "top_k": self.top_k or None,
            "top_p": self.top_p or None,
            "verbose": self.verbose,
        }

        # Remove parameters with None values
        llm_params = {k: v for k, v in llm_params.items() if v is not None}

        try:
            output = ChatOllama(**llm_params)  # type: ignore
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not initialize Ollama LLM.") from e

        return output  # type: ignore

from pathlib import Path
from langchain_core.tools import Tool

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.io import MultilineInput, MessageTextInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data

# Define a custom component for writing files
class FileWriterComponent(LCToolComponent):
    # Set display name and description of the component
    display_name = "FileWriter"
    description = "A generic file writer."
    
    # Set icon and name of the component
    icon = "file-text"
    name = "File"

    # Define input fields for the component
    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_text",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to insert in the file.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="file_name",
            display_name="File Name",
            info="Name of the file.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="projet_name",
            display_name="Projet Name",
            info=f"Root Folder of the project (will be saved in "+os.getcwd()+"\workspace)",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="subfolder_name",
            display_name="Project Subfolder",
            info=f"Project Subfolder",
        ),
    ]

    # Define the run_model method to execute the component
    def run_model(self) -> Data:
        return self._write_file()
        
    # Define a private method to write the file
    def _write_file(self) -> Data:    
        # Get input values from the inputs dictionary
        input_text = self.input_text
        file_name = self.file_name
        projet_name = self.projet_name
        subfolder_name = self.subfolder_name
        
        # Set default value for file name if not provided
        if not file_name:
            file_name = "output"

        # Get the current working directory to construct the save path
        workspace_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'workspace')

        # If projet_name is not provided, use a default folder name
        if not projet_name:
            save_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, "tmpprj")
        else:
            save_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, projet_name)
 
        # Add subfolder name to the save path if provided
        if subfolder_name:
            save_path = os.path.join(save_path, subfolder_name)
        
        # Construct the full file path
        full_path = os.path.join(save_path, file_name)

        # Check if the file path is in the workspace directory
        if workspace_path in full_path:
            # Create the save directory if it doesn't exist
            if not os.path.exists(save_path):
                os.makedirs(save_path)

            # Remove the existing file if it exists
            if os.path.exists(full_path):
                os.remove(full_path)
            
            # Open the file and write to it
            fileout = open(full_path, "a")
            fileout.write(input_text)
            fileout.close()
    
            # Return a Data object with the file path
            return Data(data={"file_path": os.path.abspath(full_path)})
        else:
            # Return an empty Data object if the file path is not in the workspace directory
            return Data()
        
    # Define the build_tool method to create the Tool instance
    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        return Tool(
            name="FileWriter",
            description="Write a file. kwargs: input_text (str), file_name (str), projet_name (str), subfolder_name (str): optional.",
            func=self._write_file,
        )
